text: Matti Allan Ahde (23 December 1945 - 20 December 2019) was a Finnish politician. He was a member of the Social Democratic Party. Ahde was born in Oulu, Finland. He was the Minister of the Interior (1982–1983), Minister of the Environment (1983–1987) and Speaker of the Parliament (1987–1989). On 20 December 2019, Ahde died from pancreatic cancer at his home in Helsinki, aged 73. ==References== Category:1945 births Category:2019 deaths Category:Deaths from pancreatic cancer Category:Speakers of the Parliament of Finland Category:Politicians from Helsinki Category:Oulu
title: Matti Ahde
